thread.title: CNO Financial Names Two Vice Presidents

author: cnbc.com
title: CNO Financial Names Two Vice Presidents
text:
CARMEL, Ind., Feb. 5, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- CNO Financial Group, Inc. (NYSE: CNO) announced today the promotion of Carrie Jost to vice president of communications and the promotion of Robert Birty to territory vice president of its Bankers Life business segment's South Central territory.
Jost will be responsible for CNO's corporate communications, public relations, sponsorship, philanthropy, enterprise branding and event marketing. She will report directly to Gerardo Monroy, chief marketing officer of CNO Financial.
"Carrie has significant experience in communications and brand marketing as well as a deep understanding of our market and customers," said Monroy. "I'm confident Carrie will continue to make strong contributions as a valuable member of our leadership team."
Jost joined CNO Financial in 2005 and most recently served as director of brand marketing. She has held several communications positions within the Bankers Life business segment, including as its manager of brand and marketing communications. Prior to CNO, Jost held positions at The Executives' Club of Chicago and the Mid-America Committee for International Business and Government Cooperation. Jost has a bachelor's degree in political science and Spanish from Illinois Wesleyan University. She currently serves as secretary of the board of directors for Meals on Wheels Chicago.
In his new role, Birty will be responsible for leading the South Central territory's field sales team in strategy and growth. He will report directly to Nathan Richardson, senior vice president of sales and distribution at Bankers Life.
"Bob is a seasoned leader with a strong record of growth and contributions within Bankers Life," said Richardson. "His elevated role reflects his deep knowledge of the business and a true commitment to our customers within the middle-income insurance market."
A 32-year veteran of Bankers Life, Birty has been with the organization since 1986. He has held several sales positions, most recently as regional director in the Northwest territory and branch sales manager of the Toms River, N.J. office. He served as chairman for the company's Agent Development Committee from 2012 to 2016 and has also sat on its Recruiting and Technology Committees.
About CNO Financial Group
CNO Financial Group, Inc. (NYSE: CNO) is a holding company. Our insurance subsidiaries – principally Bankers Life and Casualty Company, Colonial Penn Life Insurance Company and Washington National Insurance Company – primarily serve middle-income pre-retiree and retired Americans by helping them protect against financial adversity and provide for a more secure retirement. For more information, visit CNO online at www.CNOinc.com .
